poem:
### The Mirror of #SkinnyTok

In the scroll of a finger,  
a butterfly lands on the scale,  
its wings etched with whispers—  
the numbers that dance and taunt  
in the harsh glow of a teenage mirror.  
Invisible voices coil around screens,  
feeding the hourglass  
until it empties into air.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "French minister reports #SkinnyTok to regulator over anorexia concerns The French government is seeking to take action against a TikTok group promoting extreme thinness among young women and girls. France’s minister for digital media, Clara Chappaz, has reported #SkinnyTok to the country’s audiovisual and digital watchdog and the EU over concerns that the trend is body-shaming victims into anorexia and that algorithms are targeting the most vulnerable. The hashtag has been associated with more than". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
